intro: Pimpinella parnassica, commonly known as the Parnassian cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and cool, moist conditions. It is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies. Pimpinella parnassica is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is often found in botanical gardens.
